When the king saw him, he deeply marveled at the child and personally took the child's hand to observe his features.
After carefully looking at him, he said this:
The six non-Buddhist teachers claim there are no causes and effects, truly deceiving and misleading.

The king said again:

When evening came, he placed the child on an elephant and went ahead, while the king, together with his ministers, entered the garden.
And the light from the child's finger illuminated the darkness as if it were daytime, and he looked at the birds, beasts, flowers, and fruits in the garden as if it were no different from daytime.
The king, having observed this, sighed and said:

However, prosperity has decline, and union will eventually separate. The elder and his wife both passed away at the same time. It was like the sun setting, its bright light hidden. At that time, the people together drank to their heart's content, enjoyed themselves, and were delighted. Drums and bells competed in their presentation, and strings and songs were performed everywhere. They danced on the level ground and played in the fields, and the sounds of entertainment moved the mountains and filled the valleys.

At that time, the later group of thieves knew that Lamp-finger had gone to the gathering, and before he returned, they took advantage of the empty house and went to his home to rob and plunder, taking away all his money and valuables.
Lamp-finger returned in the evening and saw that his house had been robbed by thieves, with only wood, stones, bricks, and tiles left.
Having seen this, he fainted and fell to the ground. Only after his companions sprinkled water on him did he regain consciousness. He sorrowed and wept, thinking like this:
In the past, my father widely made plans and managed the family business, toiling and accumulating grain, goods, and treasures.
This is what my father did, raising my body, hoping to entrust it to me.
How is it that I, having reached adulthood, do not carry on my father's business, but float around, lazy and indolent, being bullied by others?
My father's remaining wealth will be lost in an instant, the granaries will be empty, the livestock will scatter, and looking at the house, only I will be left alone.
The jewelry and clothing on my body should be used to trade for food to save me from immediate danger.
When it is used up, what should I do?
At that time, the light on the finger also disappeared. His wife abandoned him in disgust and ran away, the servants escaped, and his relatives cut off contact.
Those who were intimate with him became extremely hostile, seeing his poverty, fearing he would beg from them, and giving rise to anger instead.
Even his wife abandoned him, let alone other people.
Know that poverty is like being in hell, and if one is born poor, it is no different from death.
Having been accustomed to wealth and pleasure, they suddenly encountered poverty and hardship, lost their support, and had nowhere to stay.

Their worried minds were burning with fire, and their sorrow and distress were scorching. Their youthful appearance faded, and their haggard looks became more apparent. Their bodies became emaciated, and hunger and thirst caused them to lose weight. Their eyes sank, and their bones protruded. Thin skin wrapped around them, and their tendons and veins were exposed. Their hair was disheveled, and their hands and feet were slender and sharp. Their complexion was pale, and their entire bodies were cracked and chapped. Moreover, they had no clothes, so they picked up coarse and tattered clothes in the filth, patched them together, and barely covered their private parts. Their naked bodies leaned against a pile of excrement, and they had no bedding.

Their relatives and old acquaintances saw them but did not recognize them. They wandered the streets begging for food like a starving crow. They went to their friend's side to beg for food, but the gatekeeper blocked them and did not let them in.
Whenever he had a chance, he would enter and insult them. When the host came out and wanted to beat him, he would bow and apologize again and again. The host would despise him and not even look back.

Even if he managed to enter the house, because of his contempt, they would not speak to him or offer him a seat. They would give him a little food and throw the dishes at him, not letting him eat his fill.
At that time, in that country, when taking a wife, giving birth to a child, or shaving the head, they would all hold a gathering.
Going to the gathering, he hoped to beg for leftover food. Because of his contempt, they would not call him to sit, but drive him to run errands.
Asking for more of what he needed, he would get a little leftover and share the same dish with the slaves.
Then he thought to himself:
Strange, strange!
How is it that I have suddenly become so poor and lowly?
He thought to himself:
Like me today, my spirit is confused, my mind and consciousness are lost, and I do not know if this is my original body or if I have received another body.
The bitterness and suffering are unparalleled in the world. It is like a forest tree without flowers, with bees flying far away;
Like grass covered in frost, the leaves wither on their own;ğŸ”½Like a dried-up pond, with no geese or cranes playing in it;
Like a burnt forest, with no deer approaching it;
Like a harvested field, with no one picking up the leftovers.
Today, being poor and destitute, speaking of past wealth and happiness is just empty talk, who would believe it?
There are many people in the world, but none who know me.
Because of my poverty, there is no way to go.
It is like a wilderness burnt by fire, with no one enjoying it;ğŸ”½Like a withered tree with no shade, with no one seeking shelter;
Like seedlings struck by hail and frost, discarded and not harvested;

Like food mixed with poison, with no one tasting it;
Like an empty charnel ground, with no one heading towards it;
Like a foul cesspool, with stench and filth filling it up;
Like an executioner, I am despised by people;
Like a constant thief, I am distrusted by people.

If I create good karma, others consider it vulgar.ğŸ”½If my actions are quick, I am again criticized for being flighty;

If I do not praise, I am again slandered, saying this poor person always has nothing good to say.

Poverty is also like this, with many difficulties;

Such sufferings arise from poverty, just as a hidden treasure often contains various objects. In the hidden treasure of poverty, there are often various mental and physical sufferings.

As for the wealthy and noble, they have good dignity, a relaxed appearance, broad-minded thoughts, and a profusion of rites and righteousness. They can give rise to wisdom and courage, increase family wealth, and have harmonious and yielding relatives, with their good reputation heard far and wide.
Lamp Finger thought:
I am now poor and destitute, with few equals in the world. I want to give up my body but cannot kill myself.
What method should I use to save myself?
He further thought:
The most despised job in the world is carrying corpses.
Although this job is evil, it does not lead to suffering in the next life;
If I do other work, I may encounter killing and do all kinds of evil.
Based on this, I request to do this job.
At that time, someone heard his words and hired him to carry corpses.

He thought to himself:
Today, carrying this dead body, where can I go to make a living?
He then went to the outcaste village and said:
Who can remove the corpse from my back? I will pay you well.
The Chandalas tried their best to pull it off, but it would not budge.
Others who saw this scolded Lamp Finger, saying:
Madman, why are you carrying a corpse into the village?
They vied with each other in beating and throwing stones at him.
His body was wounded and in pain, and he was terrified.
Someone took pity on him and brought him to the city, and they finally reached the city gate.
When they arrived at the gate, the gate guards beat him back and would not let him approach the gate, saying:
What a foolish person, wanting to bring a corpse into the city!
Seeing that his own body was beaten with sticks and his body was all broken, he was greatly distressed and cried out loudly, saying:
I am doing this shameful deed just for food.
Today, I suddenly encountered this great suffering. Because of my poverty and hardship, I took any job I could find. I did this lowly work in hopes of earning some money to sustain myself.
How could I have known that I would encounter such bitter suffering today?
It would be better to die in any other way, rather than to be born as a corpse-bearer.
He cried and spoke like this.
At that time, the gatekeeper deeply felt pity and let him return home.
When he arrived at his empty room, the poor people who had previously begged together and lived with him saw the corpse on his back from a distance and all left him.
When he reached his house, the corpse fell to the ground by itself.
At that time, Lamp Finger was even more frightened and terrified, fainted and fell to the ground, and only after a long while regained consciousness.
He then saw that the corpse's fingers were all pure gold. Although he was still afraid, seeing this good gold, he approached and examined it with a knife. It was indeed genuine gold.
Having obtained the gold, his mind was filled with joy. He then cut off the head, neck, hands, and feet.
After cutting them off, they would grow back again.
In a short while, the golden head, hands, and feet would accumulate to exceed a person's height.

It was like a king who had lost his country regaining his original position, like a blind person gaining eyes and seeing clearly, like a person who had long desired another woman getting to have intercourse with her, like a meditator suddenly attaining realization;
Lamp Finger's joy was also like this.

The treasures in his storehouse and treasury doubled that of before, and his majestic virtue and fame surpassed that of previous days. All his relatives, friends, wife, children, and servants returned.
Lamp Finger sighed and said:
Alas, how strange!
Having great wealth and power can cause people of the world to return and submit to me extremely quickly.
Alas, how strange!
Poverty has great power, and can cause those who are close to me to abandon me extremely quickly.
When I was previously poor, those who were originally close to me and socialized with me had their paths cut off, and not a single person would speak to me;
Today, everyone looks up to me, serves me, and respectfully joins their palms in reverence.
Even if one is born in a place like Indra, has the strength like Rama, and has the knowledge and insight like the Heavenly Teacher, if one has no wealth, it is of no use.
The rich, whether foolish or wise, are all considered good people. Those who know nothing are considered wise, and they also obtain the good reputation of being brave and strong;
even if they are ugly and old, young and strong women enjoy going to them.
King Ajatashatru heard that he had become rich again, and immediately sent someone to come and take his treasures.
What was taken were all dead people, thrown back into the house, seen as real gold.
Lamp Finger knew that the king wanted this treasure, so he used his golden head and hands to offer it to the king.
After the king obtained it, he took it back to the palace.
Later, Lamp Finger had this thought and spoke a verse, saying:
The five desires are extremely light and moving, like lightning, poisonous snakes and insects,
Glory and pleasure do not last long, and one immediately gives rise to a mind of disgust and loathing.
He then gave precious treasures to the people, left home to pursue the Way in the Buddha's teachings, and diligently practiced to attain arhatship.
Although he attained the fruit of the Way, this corpse treasure always followed him.

Because of the causes and conditions of evil speech, one will receive the great suffering of retribution. One should fear all kinds of suffering and stay far away from evil speech and all kinds of unwholesome karma.
Contemplating in this way, all the wealth, nobility, and splendor of worldly people are not to be greedily attached to, and one should not delight in the nobility of humans and gods;
One should know that poverty is a great mass of suffering, and in order to end poverty one should not be stingy or greedy.
